intro: Jupunba microcalyx var. enterolobioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jupunba, is a variant of the jupunba plant native to certain regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands or open woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking drought-tolerant, low-maintenance plants.
